condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2019, health facilities have equipment, inputs and skills for the treatment and care of children living with HIV and for HIV prevention

description.narrative: UNICEF significantly improved the service delivery of health facilities for children living with HIV, enhancing the Government's capacity and ensuring the provision of equipment. The number of health facilities providing prevention of Mother to Child Transmission of HIV (PMTCT) increased from 818 in 2018 to 1,112 in 2019. The number of HIV positive pregnant women identified and enrolled in ART reached 877 in 2019 versus 377 in 2018. Ten PoC (Point of Care) devices were provided to ten additional health districts which facilitated the identification and enrollment of 452 HIV positive infants in ART. | Status:Partially Met | As-of Date:07/02/2020

title.narrative: Health facilities providing life long ART for pregnant and breast feeding women within the MNCH setting
